programme.desc: A blaxploitation film about a woman whose drug-dealing brother ratted on her undercover narcotics-agent boyfriend to the mob and she, in turn, poses as a call girl to infiltrate the mobsters who butchered him.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Bakura and good Marik summon The Winged Dragon of Ra, ready to blast and banish evil Marik into the Shadow Realm. But The Winged Dragon of Ra has more than one special ability, and evil Marik knows how to use them all.
programme.sub-title: Showdown in the Shadows Part 2: Marik Vs. Bakura

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba's blimp is hijacked by a mysterious boy named Noah and his henchmen - five familiar foes from Yugi and Kaiba's past who are out for revenge!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The first to duel under the all-new Deck Master System is Yugi against Big 1 Gansley's Deepsea Warrior! Can Yugi master the complex new rules, or will the rules master him?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Yugi struggles to make heads or tails of the Deck Master System, Big 1 uses his Deck Master ability to send all of Yugi's attacks right back! How can Yugi defeat an opponent when his attacks take away his own life points?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's running out of life points, but can his cute little Deck Master Kuriboh unleash his furry fury to turn the tide of battle?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Prepare for a feathered fight when Téa squares off against Big 2 Crump's Nightmare Penguin where the loser will be trapped forever in a block of ice!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Téa's body turns more and more into a giant popsicle, can she keep her brain from freezing to find a way to melt Big 2's strategy? Or will Big 2's penguin horde waddle all over her?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey squares off against the judicial jerk Big 3 Johnson who takes the Deck Master form of Judge Man! How can Joey defeat a foe who can destroy Joey's monsters at will?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Just when Joey seems to gain the upper hand, he hits the longest streak of bad luck in the history of mankind! Has Joey's fortunes finally run out, or is a crooked judge ignoring the rules of the law?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Big 4 Nezbitt challenges Duke, Tristan, and Serenity for the right to gain control of three bodies at once! Will Serenity's errors cost her team the ultimate price when Tristan and Duke can't cover for her mistakes?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: One down, two to go! With the loss of Tristan, Serenity is heartbroken. Can she pull herself together and remember the lessons Tristan taught her to turn the duel around?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Tristan's back... but he's not who he appears to be when he kidnaps Mokuba! It's time for Kaiba to stop monkeying around and rescue his brother, but he's confronted by Big 5 Leichter!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Big 5's Satellite Cannon attacks Kaiba's monsters from deep space! Mokuba's unwavering faith in Kaiba inspires him to believe that his brother will pull out the victory, but Noah has plans to ruin their brotherhood...

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba arrives at Noah's sanctuary to rescue Mokuba, but Mokuba wants to stay with Noah! Has Mokuba seen the evil within Kaiba, or is something more sinister in the works?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Noah gives the Big Five one last chance to redeem themselves in a five-on-two tag team duel where Yugi and Joey take on the entire Big Five!
programme.sub-title: Merger of the Big Five, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Big Five concentrate their attack on Joey so that Yugi would be forced to duel all alone! Outmanned and overpowered, Yugi and Joey are near the end of the line!
programme.sub-title: Merger of the Big Five, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Big Five summon an almighty dragon that previously defeated Joey, Mai, and Mokuba! Joey and Yugi pull out all the stops, but is that enough to avoid their minds being scattered over virtual reality?
programme.sub-title: Merger of the Big Five, Part 3

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's a duel for control of KaibaCorp when Noah squares off against Kaiba! But can Kaiba fight at full strength after he learns the hidden truth about Noah... and the tragic past that made him what he is today?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Noah's Shinato's Ark steals monsters into its keep to use as an impenetrable wall of servants! How can Kaiba hurt Noah when Noah has an endless stream of monsters to protect himself with?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba's about to finish Noah, but Mokuba protects Noah from his final blow! Will Kaiba sacrifice his beloved brother in exchange for freedom, or will the brotherly bond remain unbreakable?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: For every turn that passes, one of Yugi's friends is transformed into stone! As more and more of his friends harden into solid rock, can Yugi defeat Noah before he runs out of turns and transforms into stone himself?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's friends are petrified into solid stone statues, but their spirits live on! Their combined souls energize Yugi into a noble fight, but is spirit going to win the duel when Yugi's not drawing the right cards?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi has defeated Noah... but they still can't escape from the virtual world! The real reason behind their entrapment is revealed... as is the true villain pulling the strings!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Kaiba squares off against his stepfather Gozaburo for their final battle, Yugi and friends are attacked by endless hordes of monsters! Their only hope is Noah, but they can't expect help from their enemy... can they?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Time is almost up before the missile's explosion destroys Yugi and friends! Will the Battle City finalists beat the clock and live to duel another day in the stunning conclusion to the virtual world saga!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends arrive at KaibaCorp Island where the Battle City finalists will compete in the ultimate dueling arena! Get ready for the awesome four-person battle royal where any duelist can attack anyone else!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Honor, friendship, revenge... As each duelist remembers what they're fighting for, the battle royal rages on where none of the duelists know where the next attack is going to come from!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey may have fought some of the fiercest fights in Battle City, but has all his training taught him to become an elite duelist? Joey's gonna show what he's made of in the conclusion to the four-man battle royal!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik ensnares Joey in a Shadow Game where each duelist's heart is linked with his monsters... literally! Every time a monster received damage, the duelist feels the pain instead!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik's Helpoemer send Joey's powerful cards to the graveyard before Joey can use them! Running low on cards and life points, Joey's opportunities for staging a comeback are nearly depleted!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey thinks this duel can't turn any worse... but Marik has all the pieces necessary to summon The Winged Dragon of Ra! Can Joey prevent Marik from summoning the Egyptian God Card, or is victory simply not in the cards?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik transforms The Winged Dragon of Ra into its powerful form, the Egyptian God Phoenix! If Joey can't withstand the Phoenix's blazing fire, he'll lose the duel... plus his only chance to save Mai from her mental prison!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's the rematch we've all been waiting for! Yugi and Kaiba square off for the first time since Duelist Kingdom in front of thousands of ravenous fans for the right to challenge Marik! It's time to duel!

programme.title: Franky tries to convince Usopp that there’s no hope for the Going Merry, but the sniper – inspired by a mysterious moment from the past – remains loyal to his beloved boat
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The man who is loved even by his ship! Usopp's tears!

programme.title: A look back at Franky’s past reveals the amazing origins of the sea train – and paints a vivid picture of his younger days, spent alongside Iceberg and the legendary shipwright Tom!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Franky's past! The day the sea train first ran!

programme.title: Franky’s backstory continues! The sea train is a success, and it looks like Tom’s life is spared! Unfortunately, a government spy is searching for a reason to investigate Tom, and Franky provides the ammunition!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Spandam's scheme! The day the sea train shook!

programme.title: Tom does the unthinkable in an attempt to protect his apprentices, but young Franky is unable to control his rage, leading to a showdown with a spy – and a train!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The end of the legendary man! The day the sea train cried!

programme.title: Chopper’s heroism may mean the difference between life and death for Iceberg and Paulie, Nami learns the agonizing truth about Robin, and Sanji prepares to make his move!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The truth behind her betrayal! Robin's sorrowful decision!

programme.title: Nami makes a frantic dash for the Sea Train station, Chopper searches desperately for Zoro and Luffy, and Sanji plays it cool while waiting for the right time to spring into action.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The steam whistle forces friends apart! The sea train starts to run

programme.title: Nami arrives at the train station a minute too late, Sanji makes his presence aboard the sea train known, and the search for Luffy and Zoro continues!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sanji barges in! Sea train battle in the storm!

programme.title: Chopper and Robin risk their own lives in a desperate attempt to save Luffy and Zoro from a monstrous wall of water! Meanwhile, Sanji moves ever closer to a reunion with Robin.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Nami's soul cries out! Straw hat luffy makes a comeback!

programme.title: Luffy and Nami ask to borrow a ship so they can chase down the sea train, but the weather is too severe to set sail. Lucky for them, Iceberg and his friends are full of surprises!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Another sea train? Rocketman charges forth!

programme.title: Luffy, Zoro, Chopper, and Nami rocket toward a rendezvous with the assassins of CP 9, but they’ll need to forge an alliance with some new friends to have any chance at survival!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Rescue our friends! A bond among foes sworn with fists!

programme.title: Zoro and Luffy go head-to-head with Mother Nature, and Sanji’s rescue mission is bolstered by Franky’s allegiance – and the arrival of the mysterious Sniper King!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Smash the wave! Luffy and zoro use the strongest combo!

programme.title: Sniper King, a mysterious warrior from the island of snipers, lends a hand as Franky and Sanji try to fight their way to Robin.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A mysterious man appears?! His name is sniper king!

programme.title: Sanji mixes it up with a deranged cook, Franky dukes it out with the newest member of CP9, and the Sniper King gets creative in his attempt to reach Robin!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Showdown between cooks! Sanji vs. Ramen kenpo!

programme.title: Franky and Sanji continue to battle the thugs of CP9. Meanwhile, Luffy and the rest of the gang find themselves headed for a collision that could spell doom for everyone!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Zoro faces a fellow master of the blade, Sanji looks to end his fight against a rampaging ramen master, and Franky finally lands a big blow against his CP9 foe!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Clash! Demon-slasher zoro vs. Ship-slasher t-bone!

programme.title: The Sniper King hatches a daring escape plan, but the assassins of CP9 are more powerful than our heroes ever imagined. Meanwhile, Luffy and the gang run into a very familiar frog!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Scramble over robin! A cunning plan by sniper king!

programme.title: As their train approaches Enies Lobby, Franky’s kind words cut through Robin’s cold exterior. Luffy’s train is thrown off course, but the group gains a powerful new ally!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The judicial island! Full view of enies lobby!

programme.title: The Straw Hats hatch a plan to rescue Robin, but as usual, Luffy can’t wait to find a fight. Will his impulsive attack derail their mission?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Landing operations start! Charge in, straw hats!

programme.title: Luffy manages to reach the main island, but the Franky Family’s assault is stopped short by a couple of angry giants!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Luffy cuts through! Big showdown on the judicial island!

programme.title: Luffy makes short work of a few hundred marines, the Franky Family takes down a giant, and the assassins of CP9 report back to Spandam!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Battle against giants! Open the second gate!

programme.title: Zoro’s quick thinking – and a little help from a giant frog – sends the sea train soaring into the sky on a collision course with armed guards and their canine companions!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Find a way out! Rocketman takes flight!

programme.title: Nami electrocutes the enemy with a Clima Tact attack, but the bad guys have the Straw Hats surrounded until the Franky Family shows up with a couple of sea monsters!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Catch up with luffy! The straw hats' all-out battle

programme.title: Zoro, Sanji, Nami, and Chopper try to catch up with their captain, Soge King is nowhere to be found, and Luffy runs head first into a battle with Blueno!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Robin betrayed! The motive of the world government!

programme.title: Luffy shows off his new strength in a brawl with Blueno, Soge King befriends a giant, and a hulking sea beast makes the ultimate sacrifice.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Give robin back! Luffy vs. Blueno!

programme.title: While Luffy continues his battle with Blueno, Soge King’s giant companions make their presence felt, and the assassins of CP9 experiment with Devil Fruits!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Don't stop! Hoist the counterattack signal!

programme.title: A blind Kingbull fights with his last breath to get the Straw Hats one step closer to their captain. Luffy kick his body into second gear to protect his friends from dangerous foes!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Almost to luffy! Gather at the courthouse plaza!

programme.title: Luffy batters a baffled Blueno with his powerful new fighting style, and the cowardly Spandam begins to panic at the sound of the Straw Hats approaching!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Everything is to protect my friends! Second gear activated!

programme.title: Luffy and his crew are finally reunited and ready to rescue Robin, but the raven-haired beauty remains reluctant to rejoin her former mates despite Franky’s urging.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Give us your answer, robin! The straw hats' outcry!

programme.title: Flash back to Robin’s days as a young girl, her dangerous pursuit of forbidden knowledge, and her encounter with a friendly giant.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Robin's past! The girl who was called a devil!

programme.title: Robin’s flashback continues with the heartbreaking arrival of her mother – and the government’s cruel and brutal invasion of a peaceful island!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Fated mother and daughter! The mother's name is olvia!

programme.title: Professor Clover reveals a startling and sinister theory about the World Government, Robin reunites with her mother, and a giant joins the fight!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The tragedy of ohara! The terror of the buster call!

programme.title: The painful story of Ohara – and Robin’s younger years – draws to a tragic close. Luffy declares war on the World Government, and Robin finally changes her tune!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Say you want to live! We are your friends!

programme.title: The Straw Hats are ready to begin the fight for Robin, but first, Luffy flashes back to memories of his childhood – and the man who made him want to become a pirate!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Jump towards the falls! Luffy's feelings!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The city of Grand Hexagon lies at the border of France and Spain; the city is designed with six sides. But at the center of the city is Raika Bank storing fifty tons of gold bullion; an alarm will go off if even one bullion is missing.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Robot soldier Lamda flies above the sky of Tokyo, raids a jewelry store. Its creator, professor Oyamada's daughter Maki and Lupin say that it was just a show to demonstrate the inhumanity of robots.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Notorious gangster, Al Capone left behind five tiles that reveal the location of his massive gold hoard when put together. Out of the five tiles, Lupin and Fujiko have three in their possession.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Inspector Zenigata concocts an extravagant plan to finally capture Lupin by luring him in with a fake meteor made from 6 tons of pure gold. Low and behold, his plan backfires and Lupin and his gang make off with the meteor.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin sneaks into an old castle to steal a collection of priceless angel paintings, owned by the late Malcolm Hurst. Inside the castle, Lupin meets a mysterious girl named Flora, who knows the whereabouts of the angel paintings.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen are out at sea attempting to retrieve the gold inside a sunken pirate ship. However, a female pirate gang interrupts their retrieval mission and both parties leave empty-handed.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are in South Africa to receive a nautical chart from a retired Nazi that shows the location of a sunken Nazi treasure. However, two young German soldiers interrupt the exchange and a skirmish ensues.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are in the small city of San Pico in Central America. However, the city was in the midst of a war between the Government Forces and the Guerilla Army. Leading the Guerilla Army is Jigen's old army pal, Giranco.
programme.sub-title: Here Comes Lupin in a Tank

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Unsurprisingly, Fujiko had once betrayed her heist partner Garb, known as the Grim Reaper, and left him for dead. Garb, who has seemingly returned from the dead, is determined to kill Fujiko and has an uncanny ability to dodge bullets with ease.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: A mysterious cult that idolizes a solid gold Virgin Mary statue abducts Fujiko and they're planning to burn her at the stake as a witch. However, her kidnapper and the cult leader look vaguely familiar to Lupin. Have they crossed paths before?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin has a horrible case of athlete's foot and visits Dr. Budweiser, who is also a cloning expert, for treatment. The doctor takes a sample of Lupin's skin under the guise of treating his Athlete's foot, but the doctor has another plan up his sleeve.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: A mysterious message appears in the newspaper and Lupin takes it as a sign from this late grandfather, Lupin I, to reclaim his diamond keepsake.
programme.sub-title: A Treasure That Smells Like a Trap

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin manages to steal the Dracula Heart Ruby from a mysterious woman known as Mother. The Dracula Heart Ruby is known to bleed once every century and whoever drinks its blood maintains their youth for another 100 years.
programme.sub-title: The Ruby Sheds Tears of Blood

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin steals a painting of Lupin I's beloved from Baltan Gallery in Paris. However, the painting turns out to be a forgery and Lupin has a clue as to who is painting the forgeries. With his daughter Sophie held hostage.
programme.sub-title: The Prisoner Inside the Baltan Manor

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and Fujiko attend a lavish party full of wealthy women in order to steal their jewelry. However, the castle tower where the party was being held turns out to be a rocket ship. The hijacked rocket transports the party and guests to a small island.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Mrs. Alda, a wealthy heiress is kidnapped and Lupin shows up to claim the ransom money. However, the real mastermind behind the kidnapping is Mrs. Alda herself. After she gets the ransom money, she erases Lupin's memory and frames him for the crime.
programme.sub-title: Care to Play a Kidnapping Game?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin learns he needs a pure-hearted girl to find an ancient Persian treasure and his computer chooses a girl named Lori. After getting some hands-on training from Jigen and Goemon, the two are headed to Jordan to find the treasure.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: The Golden Apple, known as "Eve's Apple" is being transported to New York City on board a luxury cruise ship and Inspector Zenigata has a gut feeling Lupin is after it. Inspector Zenigata's hunch is on the mark as Lupin and Jigen are onboard the ship.
programme.sub-title: A Golden Apple Has Its Poison

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin is over the moon when Fujiko promises to marry him if he steals the ICPO's gold for her. Lupin pulls off the heist right under Inspector Zenigata's nose, but the two soon find themselves locked up in jail.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: It's the Mafia Boss' birthday party and everyone is gambling away. Lupin's next target is the casino's safe. While attending the party, Lupin meets a girl named Jenny, who is willing to help him pull off the heist to sell her name.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin breaks out a man named Parker from a Mexican prison in order to steal the treasure Parker had hidden away somewhere.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin, who was once duped by Mamushidayu into stealing diamonds, decides its payback time. Will Lupin get his revenge and finally get his share of diamonds after all?
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Erased His Past

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: An ancient burial mound has been discovered and etched on its walls are ancient mythical creatures with jewel-encrusted eyes. Lupin makes off with the blue dragon's crystal eye and kidnaps the archeologist in charge.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang break into a vault full of uncut diamonds. However, the diamonds suddenly catch on fire, and guess who is being blamed for it!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: The Swiss Bank's Beirut branch is a mobile branch. Will Lupin manage to pull off the heist of this impenetrable bank and get out safely with Inspector Zenigata on his tail?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are after Taniyama's treasure from an ancient Chinese dynasty. Realizing that Lupin is after his treasure, Taniyama hires a lone assassin named Seiryuu to counter Goemon.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: How could Lupin and his gang refuse when a church priest asks them to retrieve the Dove's Eggs, the church's jewels, for the sake of Spoonland's children?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are in New York City to steal a pinball machine made of solid gold. Lupin, Jigen, and Fujiko board a casino cruise ship and discover that they'll need Goemon's Zantetsuken sword to pull off the heist.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang were pursuing Flight 107 when Soviet Union planes suddenly shoot it down for wandering into its territory inadvertently.
programme.sub-title: Code Name is The Star of Alaska

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: A ring called the Star of Alaska holds a single wheat seed inside it. The seed is a new species of wheat that can grow in minus 40 degrees and the CIA and KGB are determined to get their hands on it.
programme.sub-title: The Star of Alaska Is a Ticket to Hell

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin is over the moon, now that he's won Fujiko's hand in marriage after stealing Marie Antoinette's wedding dress and ring.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: A massive amount of gold is being transported in the cover of darkness, but on this rainy night, Lupin is busy being a bartender to a beautiful woman named Sara.
programme.sub-title: The Name of the Cocktail Is Revenge

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 3
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang steal an exquisite painting of a young girl from a Renoir art exhibit. Using the painting as bait, Lupin and his gang plan to steal Ghellon's impressive art collection.

programme.title: Universal Soldier, (1992, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A woman reporter discovers a Defense Department project to create androids from the bodies of Vietnam soldiers, to be then used as an elite anti-terrorism unit.

programme.title: Skyline, (2010, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Jarrod and Elaine travel to Los Angeles to meet his friend Terry and his wife Candice. Terry gives a party in his apartment for Jarrod. The next morning, the group is awakened by beams of light. The group of friends try to escape from the alien invaders.

programme.title: Ultraviolet, (2006, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich, Cameron Bright Nick Chinlund and William Fichtner star in this theatrical set in the late 21st century, where some humans have been modified genetically by a vampire-like disease and the world is pushed to the brink of worldwide civil war.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn, (1996, Horror)
programme.desc: In this thrilling cult classic, two dangerous outlaw brothers head out on a wild crime spree. After kidnapping a father and his two kids, the bad guys head to a seedy Mexican bar for safety but come face to face with blood-sucking vampires.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn 2: Texas Blood Money, (1999, Horror)
programme.desc: When a gang of bank robbers makes a run for the border, they wander into the wrong bar and mess with the wrong vampires. It's kill-or-be-killed in the ultimate battle to stop these evil creatures and save their own lives!

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn 3: Hangman's Daughter, (1999, Horror)
programme.desc: Set in Mexico in the early 1900s, this prequel to the From Dusk Till Dawn series finds outlaw Johnny Madrid on the run from the hangman, with the hangman's daughter Esmeralda by his side. Together they are faced with the fight of their lives.

programme.title: Universal Soldier, (1992, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A woman reporter discovers a Defense Department project to create androids from the bodies of Vietnam soldiers, to be then used as an elite anti-terrorism unit.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn, (1996, Horror)
programme.desc: In this thrilling cult classic, two dangerous outlaw brothers head out on a wild crime spree. After kidnapping a father and his two kids, the bad guys head to a seedy Mexican bar for safety but come face to face with blood-sucking vampires.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn 2: Texas Blood Money, (1999, Horror)
programme.desc: When a gang of bank robbers makes a run for the border, they wander into the wrong bar and mess with the wrong vampires. It's kill-or-be-killed in the ultimate battle to stop these evil creatures and save their own lives!

programme.title: The Way West, (1967, Western)
programme.desc: Icons Kirk Douglas, Robert Mitchum and Richard Widmark star in this sumptuous, epic tale of the brave men and women in the U.S. who left the comfort and safety of life in the East for the promise of free land a better life in the untamed West.

programme.title: Return To Lonesome Dove, (1993, Western)
programme.desc: Back in Texas, Capt. Call organizes a mustang drive to Montana. He hires a Gideon, a former Texas Ranger, to head the drive. Newt falls into trouble in is rescued by a crusty rancher named Dunnegan.
programme.sub-title: Return To Lonesome Dove: Part I - The Vision

programme.title: Return To Lonesome Dove, (1993, Western)
programme.desc: Gideon's mustang drive encounters problems. Agostina must fend off the unwanted advances of cowboys. Call makes his way to Clara's ranch, and then moves on to Montana.
programme.sub-title: Return To Lonesome Dove: Part II - The Forge

programme.title: Return To Lonesome Dove, (1993, Western)
programme.desc: Clara's ranch meets an fiery fate, and she decides to join with Gideon. Call has the misfortune to meet up with the desperado Cherokee Jack. Dunnegan tells Newt of his inheritance plans.
programme.sub-title: Return To Lonesome Dove: Part III - The Legacy

programme.title: Return To Lonesome Dove, (1993, Western)
programme.desc: A range war is erupting in Montana, and Call and Dunnegan meet alone to settle their differences. Cherokee Jack is running amok. Call tells Newt about their true relationship.
programme.sub-title: Return To Lonesome Dove: Part IV - The Passing

programme.title: Rio Grande, (1950, Western)
programme.desc: Lt. Col. Yorke leads his cavalry troops to the Rio Grande to fight a warring tribe. Yorke’s toughest battle lies ahead when his unorthodox plan to outwit the elusive Apaches leads to possible court-martial.

programme.title: The Horse Soldiers, (1959, Action)
programme.desc: John Wayne, Constance Towers and William Holden star in this 1863, fact-based story about a Union mission to destroy a railroad junction deep within Confederate territory.

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, (1962, Western)
programme.desc: Jimmy Stewart plays the bungling but charming big-city lawyer determined to rid the fair village of Shinbone of its number one nuisance and bad man: Liberty Valance.

programme.title: Stagecoach, (1939, Western)
programme.desc: Dallas is a woman with a past who has been driven out of town by the high-minded ladies of the community. Lucy Mallory is the wife of a cavalry officer stationed in Lordsburg, and she's determined to be with him.

programme.title: Nacho Libre, (2006, Comedy)
programme.desc: Jack Black is more hilarious than ever as Ignacio, a monastery cook who feeds orphan children by day and by night transforms himself into Nacho Libre, a notorious Luchador in stretchy pants.

programme.title: Norbit, (2007, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: Murphy stars as mild-mannered Norbit, who gets a second chance at love with his childhood sweetheart, Kate. However, obstacles may make this romance slightly more difficult than expected.

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, (2001, Screwball)
programme.desc: The comic "Bluntman and Chronic" is adapted for the big-screen by Hollywood without the permission of the real-life stoner icons of CLERKS— Jay and Silent Bob.

programme.title: Big Fish, (2003, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Throughout his life, Edward Bloom (Ewan McGregor) has always been a man of big appetites, enormous passions and tall tales.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and Chibi-Usa meet a woman named Rubina who follows them. Rubina is a princess who snuck out to experience life outside of her royal duties.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and the girls attend the school festival. Makoto is asked to dance by a handsome man, who is actually Tiger's Eye in disguise.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Fish's Eye goes after Mamoru. But Mamoru seems to show no interest in being with anyone besides Usagi.
programme.sub-title: Shadow of Evil: The Trio's Last Chance

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Zirconia threatens the Amazon Trio that if they don’t capture Pegasus by the next new moon, the magic making them human will wear off.
programme.sub-title: Mirrors of Dreams: The Amazon's Last Stage

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and her friends go to see a show at the Dead Moon Circus. But Momo starts acting peculiar and leaves, causing Chibi-Usa to become worried.
programme.sub-title: The Amazoness: Nightmare from Behind the Mirrors

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Ami falls in love with a melody she finds online. She works on lyrics that match the melody and also goes to meet the composer, Toshiyuki Nishino.
programme.sub-title: True Power Explodes: Ami's Melody of the Heart

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Rei becomes famous after posing for a magazine. A girl named Nanako, expresses her desire to study under Rei so that she can become just like her.
programme.sub-title: Flames of Passion: Mars's Raging Super Attack

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and Chibi-Usa go to the dentist to get their cavities treated. The dental clinic is actually a trap set up by Palla-Palla to find Pegasus.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Minako and Makoto compete to win the heart of Honjo, a young principal. But their rivalry starts to put a strain on their friendship.
programme.sub-title: Clash of Dreams: Minako and Makoto's Broken Friendship

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa’s school is having a sports day. However, one of its main events is jumping over the vaulting box, which Chibi-Usa is not very good at.
programme.sub-title: Overcome Your Fear: The Jump to Freedom

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa and Usagi befriend a young painter named Kamoi at the park. Kamoi is visited by Cere-Cere, who asks the man to paint a portrait of her.
programme.sub-title: Don't Lose Sight of Your Dreams: The Mirror of Truth

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa is curious to know why Pegasus is reluctant to tell her where he came from. When she confronts Pegasus with the question, he disappears.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Palla-Pall turns Sailor Chibi Moon into an adult and Sailor Moon into a child. Chibi-Usa turns into shock when Pegasus can no longer hear her.
programme.sub-title: Pegasus's Secret: The Boy Who Protects the Dream World

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The girls begin to suspect that Chibi-Usa is in love. Eager to know who the boy is, they try to get Chibi-Usa to talk, but with little success.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and her friends help set up the stage for the Coming of Age Day ceremony. They befriend four girls who are actually the Amazoness Quartet.
programme.sub-title: Dream to be an Adult: The Amazoness' Confusion

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Strange spider webs begin to appear all across the Juban District. The girls notice that these webs are all originating from the Dead Moon Circus.
programme.sub-title: Terror in Motion: The Dark Queen's Evil Hand

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Nehelenia sets her plan in motion by starting a solar eclipse that will leave the world in eternal darkness.
programme.sub-title: The Source of Darkness: Dead Moon Circus

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The Dead Moon discovers that Sailor Chibi Moon was hiding Pegasus and captures her. Sailor Chibi Moon learns the history behind the Dead Moon's queen.
programme.sub-title: Labyrinth of Mirrors: Chibi Moon Captured

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Nehelenia demands that Helios give up the Golden Crystal in exchange for Sailor Chibi Moon. The Sailor Guardians are struggling to defeat Zirconia.
programme.sub-title: The Golden Crystal Appears: Nehalennia's Magic

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Nehelenia regains her full power and proceeds to put the world into an eternal slumber.Sailor Moon tries to activate the power of the Golden Crystal.

programme.desc: The Golden Crystal’s power defeats Nehelenia, pushing her back into the abyss. Nehelenia tries to take Sailor Chibi Moon with her.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Hotaru starts to age at an accelerated rate, from a baby to a young girl within days. She warns of coming danger that will soon befall Sailor Moon.

programme.title: Sailor Moon

programme.desc: Sailor Chibi Moon and Sailor Saturn make it to Nehalennia’s palace, where Mamoru is being held prisoner. The two Guardians are unable to free him.

programme.desc: Usagi runs into Seiya and is annoyed by his cocky attitude. The next day, Seiya and the rest of Three Lights have transferred to her school.
programme.sub-title: A School Storm: The Transfer Students Are Idols
